page.title: 20IMPRESSIONS OF TWO VILLAGES
page.content: {Holme Lacy}is a{sleepy little village. {Dinedor,}its nearest neighbour, is even sleepier. {Holme Lacy}only has about{50 houses, Dinedor}about{20. The people are{relaxed and friendly and have{time to talk}to each other and to strangers, and to wait. Nobody was in a hurry, and even the people doing something - building, or gardening, or going to the{Post Office - seemed not to be busy. Most of them are{old and retired. }The villages are tucked away in a {beautiful corner of Herefordshire,}and seem remote even in a{remote area. }It feels as if{time is standing still, especially in Dinedor,where even a dog in the road is interesting. The people seem to be{quite cut off}from the rest of the world, and as a result are very occupied with the affairs of their village and their neighbours.
